definition: to accept a gift/to receive presents
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: Either the recipient hates them or they're the wrong size.
sentences.chinese: 要么是收礼人根本不喜欢，要么是东西送错了尺寸。

sentences.english: So maybe the art of receiving is even more difficult than the art of giving.
sentences.chinese: 因此也许收礼的艺术甚至要比给予的艺术更难。

sentences.english: Gifts are not opened when received.
sentences.chinese: 收礼时不能当面打开礼物。

sentences.english: Comp: He not only refused the gift, he also severely criticized the young sender.
sentences.chinese: 他不仅拒绝收礼，而且严厉地批评了年轻的送礼者。

definition: to give a present
monetary gift
to be a guest at a dinner party/to be wined and dined (as a bribe)
to accept a gift/to acknowledge greetings
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
gift money (on the occasion of a wedding etc)
nobody will find fault with extra courtesy (idiom)/courtesy costs nothing
gift/present
goose feather sent from afar, a trifling present with a weighty thought behind it (idiom); It's not the gift that counts, but the thought behind it.
tip given on a happy occasion (traditional)
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
at the Chinese New Year or other festivities
gift/present/CL:件[jian4],個|个[ge4],份[fen4]
congratulatory gift
money wrapped in red as a gift/bonus payment/kickback/bribe
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
